Find tech experiences around you

  • Feb8

    Hack(H)er

    Learn More

    February 8-9, 2020UMass Amherst (Amherst, MA)

    Attend UMass's hackathon focusing on diversity and inclusion in February over the course of 24 hours! This hackathon is very beginner friendly and includes free transportation from Boston to Amherst.

  • Nov19

    Women Empowered To Financially Thrive

    Learn More

    November 19th, 2019Boston, MA

    Join Thrive, Women in Finance, and Women in Business on November 19th for an event aimed to educate and empower students and young professionals on the topics of building their net worth, self worth, and network. There will be a panel of four accomplished female entrepreneurs and executives followed by Q&A and a networking session.

  • Nov7

    Discover Brigham 2019

    Register

    November 7th, 2019Boston, MA

    Discover Brigham is an event at Brigham and Women’s Hospital that brings the Boston healthcare ecosystem to educate and inspire collaboration around innovative science, technology, and medicine. Talks will span across research and clinical disciplines, and there will be sessions covering clinical innovation, CAR-T cell therapy, health equity, opioids, and more. You may be especially interested in the Canary demo or the Engineering in Medicine session.

  • Nov9

    Technica Hackathon

    Register

    November 9th-10th, 2019Boston, MA

    Technica is the world’s largest all-women and nonbinary hackathon, hosted annually at the University of Maryland. Over the duration of 24 hours, Women and non-binary people are immersed in tech culture and encouraged to exercise their imagination to create interesting and innovative hacks.

  • Nov19

    Critical Stack Code-A-Thon

    Learn More

    November 19th, 2019Boston, MA

    Critical Stack, a container orchestration and the first commercial software product launched by Capital One, is hosting a coding competition on Saturday, November 2nd at the Cambridge Innovation Center office at 50 Milk Street in Boston. You'll compete in teams of 3 or fewer to build the best Kubernetes custom resource. The top prize is $2500!

  • Oct23

    Natalie Egan - Scaling Empathy and Equality Through Tech

    Learn More

    October 23rd, 2019Boston, MA

    Natalie Egan, founder and CEO of Translator, is coming to campus! She brings a wealth of experience in software entrepreneurship and an importance message on empathy and equality in tech.

  • Sep14

    Tufts Women in Technology Conference

    Register

    September 14th, 2019Boston, MA

    The conference strives to foster a community that empowers women and non-binary people, expose attendees to new and exciting Computer Science concepts, and prepare them to launch careers in the tech field. There will be speakers, resume reviews, interview prep, and workshops.

  • Sep14

    HackMIT

    Register

    September 14th, 2019Boston, MA

    The first round of registration is now open at hackmit.org! Come join other passionate hackers, find your inspiration, and pursue your ideas at this 24-hour hackathon from September 14 to 15! Whether you’re an experienced engineer, amateur maker, artist, or technology enthusiast, we invite you to join our vibrant community.

    Join oStem

    Join

    N/ABoston, MA

In the past, oSTEM at Northeastern has hosted a wide variety of meetings, including guest speakers, LinkedIn and “Dress for Success” workshops, and community-building activities!

  • N/AN/A

    Treatment Study for Women who experienced Sexual Assault or Violence

    Participate

    N/ABoston, MA

    Boston University researchers are looking for participants for a study that is comparing two therapy treatments for trauma related symptoms resulting from sexual assault or interpersonal violence. All study visits are located on BU’s Charles River campus, and eligible participants receive treatment at no cost and are compensated for other study visits.

  • N/AN/A

    NEU SGA Website - Personal Project Opportunity

    Apply

    N/ABoston, MA

    The Director of Information Management for the Northeastern Student Government Association has reached out to NUWIT in search of someone who wants to take on the website (northeasternsga.com) as a personal web design project. They are looking for someone who wants to take the website as it currently is and make it the best it can be. They know that, while currently functional, the website could be so much better. If any of you would be very interested in a project like this, please reach out to the director, Drew Roberts (roberts.and@husky.neu.edu)!

  • N/AN/A

    Mentor Matching Engine (MME)

    Sign Up

    N/ABoston, MA

    Interested in mentoring opportunities? The Illinois Science & Technology Institute (ISTI) is a nonprofit organization that runs a virtual mentoring platform called the Mentor Matching Engine (MME). MME is an online collaboration tool that pairs Illinois high school students with mentors to collaborate on student-driven research projects. MME is a great way for professionals to volunteer and give back to younger students - anytime, anywhere. It is also a helpful way to build your own experience in your field of study, build your CV, get students interested in your college, and interact with your community.

  • N/AN/A

    Looking for developer for MIT Startup Akora

    Apply

    N/ABoston, MA

    Akora is an online education platform connecting inquisitive minds with their peers and instructors in virtual seminars. At Akora we believe online learning needs to be social. We are currently looking for a web developer that would be interested in working with us. If you are interested, we are also looking for cofounder level members that might be interested in joining our team.
